metadata.title: CVE-2018-12182 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Insufficient memory write check in SMM service for EDK II may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege,information disclosure and/or denial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.3+esm1
qemu-efi - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.3+esm1
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.3+esm1
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: edk2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.3+esm1').
